remarks: A constructed tuple is a point in a structure product iff each coordinate is in the proper base set.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Jul-2015.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 13-Sep-2015.)
statement:
prdsbasmpt2.y $e |- Y = ( S Xs_ ( x e. I |-> R ) ) $.
prdsbasmpt2.b $e |- B = ( Base ` Y ) $.
prdsbasmpt2.s $e |- ( ph -> S e. V ) $.
prdsbasmpt2.i $e |- ( ph -> I e. W ) $.
prdsbasmpt2.r $e |- ( ph -> A. x e. I R e. X ) $.
prdsbasmpt2.k $e |- K = ( Base ` R ) $.
prdsbasmpt2 $p |- ( ph -> ( ( x e. I |-> U ) e. B <-> A. x e. I U e. K ) ) $.
$d I x $.
